page.title: 15Camp Meg (continued)
page.content: Meg was a curious sight and no wonder people were afraid of her. She was quite manly and dressed in a great army coat and wellington boots. She often travelled to local villages and towns on market day on her horse called Skewball and her bulldog called Help ran behind her. One day she entered Skewball in a race and he won. She became quite a character. A young man appeared at her doorstep and it turned out to be her son. He begged her to come home to Galloway with him but she refused. She was found lying dead in the snow during one severe winter. She'd been lying there for a few days. She was buried in the old Newbattle Cemetry.
